title: Bars - Making your own esoteric language

data.title: Bars - Making your own esoteric language
data.statement:
An esoteric language, or "esolang", is a programming language intended to entertain or confuse, to be a joke or to explore new concepts. 

Your goal is to make an interpreter for a simple esolang called Bars.
In Bars, all numeric values are represented by their value in pipes ({{|}}). Since zero can't be represented by the absence of pipes, it is represented by a tilde ({{~}}).

For example:
4 -> ||||
10  -> ||||||||||
3.014 -> |||.~||||||||||||||
-3 -> -|||
0 -> ~

You will be given a Bars operation, you must execute it and output the operation as well as the resulting value in base 10.
For the sake of simplicity, the only Bars code to be interpreted is mathematical operations between two operands.

If the code does not respect Bars syntax (i.e. it contains characters other than {{|~+-*.}}), output {{Syntax Error}}
data.constraints:
Operations will only include additions, subtractions and multiplications between two operands.
Operation chars ({{+-*}}) will never be in first or last position of the input string.
data.inputDescription: <<Line 1:>> A string [[s]] containing an operation written in Bars syntax
data.outputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> the operation in numeric (regular) syntax 
<<Line 2:>> the output in base 10 or {{Syntax Error}}  if the input string does not respect Bars syntax

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

An esoteric language, or "esolang", is a programming language intended to entertain or confuse, to be a joke or to explore new concepts.

Your goal is to make an interpreter for a simple esolang called Bars.
In Bars, all numeric values are represented by their value in pipes (|). Since zero can't be represented by the absence of pipes, it is represented by a tilde (~).

For example:
4 -> ||||
10 -> ||||||||||
3.014 -> |||.~||||||||||||||
-3 -> -|||
0 -> ~

You will be given a Bars operation, you must execute it and output the operation as well as the resulting value in base 10.
For the sake of simplicity, the only Bars code to be interpreted is mathematical operations between two operands.

If the code does not respect Bars syntax (i.e. it contains characters other than |~+-*.), output Syntax Error
Input
Line 1: A string s containing an operation written in Bars syntax
Output
Line 1: the operation in numeric (regular) syntax
Line 2: the output in base 10 or Syntax Error if the input string does not respect Bars syntax
Constraints
Operations will only include additions, subtractions and multiplications between two operands.
Operation chars (+-*) will never be in first or last position of the input string.
Example
Input
||||||||+~
Output
8+0
8
